comment: DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR FOR ONLINE. I can tell she is a nice person but this class was so miserable for just a freshman theater class. Hard grader and annoying assignments. Multiple essays and a big final. Her feedback does not make sense with her grading. Just don't take this unless you want to put in more work than your actual hard classes.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Pros: Very nice, will work with you | The teacher (theoretically) does not understand how to detect certain unwanted writing sources. | Cons: Multitude of platforms used for assignments. | Students have to reply on your post, and you must reply back for credit. | Unclear instructions on assignments | Can't write more but its BAD just dont take it.

She's a nice teacher overall but she is a little forgetful when it comes to grading and course load gets way more heavy at the end of the semester almost like she's trying to cram everything in. Also she puts everything that hasn't been assigned/due yet as a 0 in the gradebook so you will have to calculate your grade yourself to get a average.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Graded by few things

comment: The professor was nice but the workload was a lot. The final technically had like three different parts to it. The quizzes and tests were annoying but you have unlimited tries for reading quizzes.The class was really easy. Her feedback on assignments were vague and frustrating so I never knew what I was doing wrong.

For a class that isn't even a required class for my major, this is a horrible class. Im sure shes a nice lady but for her class to be a requirement to graduate, she has the biggest workload ever imaginable. 50 question QUIZZES every week that + a group assignment every week and a 2 essays ??? I am so miserable right now PLEASE do not take her!!!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Lots of homework

comment: I don't think the teacher herself is bad as a person, but this course's workload is ridiculous. There is no way there should be a project due every other week, along with weekly quizzes (some of which we must create ourselves), 2 large essays, and pretty much 3 types of finals (final script, final performance, and final exam).
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: I thought this would be an enjoyable class but this professor sucks all the enjoyment out of an interesting topic. She is passionate about the subject material but her lectures are long-winded & will put you to sleep. She gives unnecessarily long quizzes and has a self-important vibe about her class that is obnoxious. I would not take her again.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Tough grader

comment: so extra gives way too much work for a theatre class and thinks her class is the most important when I'm only taking it because its a university requirement. grades things ridiculously
rating_tags: Lots of homework--So many papers--Tough grader

comment: She is an awful teacher! She is way too strict when grading papers and discussion boards and the workload is outrageous for a required intro class. If you happen to have an emergency and miss one of the performances, she will not do anything to help you. I highly suggest taking ANY other teacher.
I don't know why her rating is so low. It's such an easy class. Tests and everything are online, and she's fun. Easy A.

Get ready to write and do a ton of work.  She takes her class very seriously.  I took this class online and the workload is outrageous for an intro class.  Group project that requires you to meet even in an online class. Way too much work for a required arts course.

She is great. She is so sweet and very helpful. The only mandatory days are the project days for the final play at the end. It's not bad at all. She doesn't give a crazy workload it is very manageable. Make sure you do the discussion boards and quizzes and show up on required days, and you'll be fine. I ended up really enjoying her class!
This professor was awesome and I thoroughly enjoyed her class.

I hated this class. Even though it was online we were required to attend project meetings and if we didn't we had 10 points deducted. The point of an online class is flexibility, this isn't flexible. Huge amount of work for a introductory course!! More work in this class than any other. She's nice and helpful but I feel she expects way too much.

It is great that she is passionate about her subject, but other than that I do not recomend her.  For a general ed requirement there is far too heavy of a work load with little to no explanation of the guidelines. She has frequent quizzes and there is a great deal of outside work and time involved if you want to get a high grade.

All quizzes and tests are online. For quizzes she allows three attempts. The text is not really needed. She requires a lot of work and doesnt give clear guidelines.The biggest thing is the group play and that is worked on all semester. It takes A LOT of work to make a good grade in this class. The workload is heavy and she grades very strictly.

If you think you know Theatre, this Professor will put you to the test!  Sharing this great adventure with her will make you feel like an Oscar in the end. This course brought out the best in me!  Awsome !!!!!!!
Professor Giardina is passionate about theater but teaching is not her strong point. Her projects are too big for the semester and everything about her grading and what she requires is very unclear.
i find this professor wonderful, as long as you can keep up with fast pace and some scattered brain-ness, very enjoyable as a whole. the final project is allot of work though.

Very passionate about her subject. Although sometimes her directions aren't crystal clear, she states the entire course layout in the syllabus. She strictly enforces your attendance, anymore then one absence will negatively affect your grade. She also requires you to see numerous forms of theater before writing a research paper on the performance.

Professor "G" is awesome. The final was the hardest part of the class, but she works with you to make it the best it can be. I don't know who these other people took, but it doesn't describe her at all. The tests were easy, as long as you listened to the lectures. Guest lectures were very good too. Not a dull moment and an easy A.

This class was INCREDIBLY easy, and I actually learned a lot. Performances are mandatory and you must write papers after them, but the material is clear and she helps if you have questions. The final is a group project play production, which can be a challenge, but you get a whole semester to work on it. The tests are all multiple choice - easy A!

I've had a lot of professors in the past 3 years, and I can safely say that this has been the worse one of them all. She took the fun out of what I thought would have been an interesting course by assigning a paper to write after every performance and with her temper tantrums during class. Wish this professor only on your worst enemy.
No Comments
You DO NOT want to take this class from this professor.  She treats the class like they are in first grade, thinks she is an actress or a director and no one understands how she grades  papers.
If you want to right research papers on plays then this is your class.  She took the joy out of theatre...
